member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.Descriptons.TextureViewDescription.Format
member.summary: An optional which specifies how the data within will be viewed. If this value is null, then the created TextureView will use the same as the target . If not null, this format must be "compatible" with the target Texture's. For uncompressed formats, the overall size and number of components in this format must be equal to the underlying format. For compressed formats, it is only possible to use the same PixelFormat or its sRGB/non-sRGB counterpart.

member.name: T:Ez.Graphics.API.EdgeSample
member.summary: Edge sampling used when coordinates when are not in the [0, 1] range.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.EdgeSample.Repeat
member.summary: The texture coordinate wraps around the texture. So a texture coordinate of -0.2 becomes the equivalent of 0.8.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.EdgeSample.MirrorRepeat
member.summary: The texture coordinate wraps around like a mirror. So a texture coordinate of -0.2 becomes 0.2 and -1.2 becomes 0.8.

member.summary: Identifies how a or will be mapped into CPU address space.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.MapMode.Read
member.summary: A read-only resource mapping. The mapped data region is not writable, and cannot be used to transfer data into the graphics resource. NOTE: This mode can only be used on resources created with the Staging usage flag.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.MapMode.Write
member.summary: A write-only resource mapping. The mapped data region is writable, and will be transferred into the graphics resource when or is called. NOTE: upon mapping a buffer with this mode, the previous contents of the resource will be erased. This mode can only be used to entirely replace the contents of a resource.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.MapMode.ReadWrite
member.summary: A read-write resource mapping. The mapped data region is both readable and writable. NOTE: this mode can only be used on resources created with the Staging usage flag.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.PrimitiveType.Triangles
member.summary: Vertices 0, 1, and 2 form a triangle. Vertices 3, 4, and 5 form a triangle. And so on.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.PrimitiveType.TriangleStrip
member.summary: Every group of 3 adjacent vertices forms a triangle.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.PrimitiveType.Lines
member.summary: Vertices 0 and 1 are considered a line. Vertices 2 and 3 are considered a line. And so on.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.PrimitiveType.LineStrip
member.summary: The adjacent vertices are considered lines. Thus, if you pass n vertices, you will get n-1 lines.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.API.PrimitiveType.Points
member.summary: Every earch vertex is a point.

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.API.IGraphicsDevice.IsUvOriginTopLeft
member.summary: Gets a value identifying whether texture coordinates begin in the top left corner of a Texture. If true, (0, 0) refers to the top-left texel of a Texture. If false, (0, 0) refers to the bottom-left texel of a Texture. This property is useful for determining how the output of a Framebuffer should be sampled.

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.API.IGraphicsDevice.IsDepthRangeZeroToOne
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this device's depth values range from 0 to 1. If false, depth values instead range from -1 to 1.

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.API.IGraphicsDevice.IsClipSpaceYInverted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this device's clip space Y values increase from top (-1) to bottom (1). If false, clip space Y values instead increase from bottom (-1) to top (1).

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.API.IGraphicsDevice.MinUniformBufferOffsetAlignment
member.summary: The required alignment, in bytes, for uniform buffer offsets. Offset must be a multiple of this value. When binding a ResourceSet to a with an overload accepting dynamic offsets, each offset must be a multiple of this value.

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.API.IGraphicsDevice.MinStorageBufferOffsetAlignment
member.summary: The required alignment, in bytes, for structured buffer offsets. Offset must be a multiple of this value. When binding a ResourceSet to a with an overload accepting dynamic offsets, each offset must be a multiple of this value.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R4G4B4A4UNorm
member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 16-bit packed unsigned normalized format that has a 4-bit R component in bits 12..15, a 4-bit G component in bits 8..11, a 4-bit B component in bits 4..7, and a 4-bit A component in bits 0..3.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.B4G4R4A4UNorm
member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 16-bit packed unsigned normalized format that has a 4-bit B component in bits 12..15, a 4-bit G component in bits 8..11, a 4-bit R component in bits 4..7, and a 4-bit A component in bits 0..3.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R5G6B5UNorm
member.summary: Specifies a three-component, 16-bit packed unsigned normalized format that has a 5-bit R component in bits 11..15, a 6-bit G component in bits 5..10, and a 5-bit B component in bits 0..4.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.B5G6R5UNorm
member.summary: Specifies a three-component, 16-bit packed unsigned normalized format that has a 5-bit B component in bits 11..15, a 6-bit G component in bits 5..10, and a 5-bit R component in bits 0..4.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R5G5B5A1UNorm
member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 16-bit packed unsigned normalized format that has a 5-bit R component in bits 11..15, a 5-bit G component in bits 6..10, a 5-bit B component in bits 1..5, and a 1-bit A component in bit 0.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.B5G5R5A1UNorm
member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 16-bit packed unsigned normalized format that has a 5-bit B component in bits 11..15, a 5-bit G component in bits 6..10, a 5-bit R component in bits 1..5, and a 1-bit A component in bit 0.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.A1R5G5B5UNorm
member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 16-bit packed unsigned normalized format that has a 1-bit A component in bit 15, a 5-bit R component in bits 10..14, a 5-bit G component in bits 5..9, and a 5-bit B component in bits 0..4.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R11G11B10UFloat
member.summary: Specifies a three-component, 32-bit packed unsigned floating-point format that has a 10-bit B component in bits 22..31, an 11-bit G component in bits 11..21, an 11-bit R component in bits 0..10.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R9G9B9E5UFloat
member.summary: Specifies a three-component, 32-bit packed unsigned floating-point format that has a 5-bit shared exponent in bits 27..31, a 9-bit B component mantissa in bits 18..26, a 9-bit G component mantissa in bits 9..17, and a 9-bit R component mantissa in bits 0..8.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R8UNorm

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R8SInt

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R8G8SNorm

member.summary: Specifies a two-component, 16-bit unsigned integer format that has an 8-bit R component in byte 0, and an 8-bit G component in byte 1.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R8G8SInt
member.summary: Specifies a two-component, 16-bit signed integer format that has an 8-bit R component in byte 0, and an 8-bit G component in byte 1.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R8G8B8A8UNorm
member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 32-bit unsigned normalized format that has an 8-bit R component in byte 0, an 8-bit G component in byte 1, an 8-bit B component in byte 2, and an 8-bit A component in byte 3.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R8G8B8A8SNorm
member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 32-bit signed normalized format that has an 8-bit R component in byte 0, an 8-bit G component in byte 1, an 8-bit B component in byte 2, and an 8-bit A component in byte 3.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.PixelFormat.R8G8B8A8UInt
member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 32-bit unsigned integer format that has an 8-bit R component in byte 0, an 8-bit G component in byte 1, an 8-bit B component in byte 2, and an 8-bit A component in byte 3.

member.summary: Specifies a four-component, 32-bit signed integer format that has an 8-bit R component in byte 0, an 8-bit G component in byte 1, an 8-bit B component in byte 2, and an 8-bit A component in byte 3.
